info.title: Azure OpenAI API version 2024-10-21
info.description: APIs for fine-tuning and managing deployments of OpenAI models.

get.summary: Gets a list of all batches owned by the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last event from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of batches to retrieve. Defaults to 20.

post.summary:
Creates and executes a batch from an uploaded file of requests.
Response includes details of the enqueued job including job status.
The ID of the result file is added to the response once complete.

parameters.name: createBatchRequest
parameters.description: The specification of the batch to create and execute.

200.description: The batch has been successfully created.

get.summary: Gets details for a single batch specified by the given batch-id.

parameters.name: batch-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the batch.

post.summary: Cancels the processing of the batch specified by the given batch-id.

parameters.name: batch-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the batch.

200.description: The batch has been successfully canceled.

get.summary:
Gets a list of all files owned by the Azure OpenAI resource.
These include user uploaded content like files with purpose "fine-tune" for training or validation of fine-tunes models
as well as files that are generated by the service such as "fine-tune-results" which contains various metrics for the corresponding fine-tune job.

parameters.name: purpose
parameters.description: Only return files with the given purpose.

values.description: This file contains training data for a fine tune job.
This file contains the results of a fine tune job.
This file contains data to be used in assistants.
This file contains the results of an assistant.
This file contains the input data for a batch.
This file contains the results of a batch.

post.summary: Creates a new file entity by uploading data from a local machine. Uploaded files can, for example, be used for training or evaluating fine-tuned models.

parameters.name: purpose
parameters.description: The intended purpose of the uploaded documents. Use "fine-tune" for fine-tuning. This allows us to validate the format of the uploaded file.

values.description: This file contains training data for a fine tune job.
This file contains the results of a fine tune job.
This file contains data to be used in assistants.
This file contains the results of an assistant.
This file contains the input data for a batch.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Gets or sets the file to upload into Azure OpenAI.

201.description: The file has been successfully created.

Location.description: The location of the newly created item.

get.summary: Gets details for a single file specified by the given file-id including status, size, purpose, etc.

parameters.name: file-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the file.

delete.summary:
Deletes the file with the given file-id.
Deletion is also allowed if a file was used, e.g., as training file in a fine-tune job.

parameters.name: file-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the file.

get.summary:
Gets the content of the file specified by the given file-id.
Files can be user uploaded content or generated by the service like result metrics of a fine-tune job.

parameters.name: file-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the file.

post.summary: Creates a new file entity by importing data from a provided url. Uploaded files can, for example, be used for training or evaluating fine-tuned models.

parameters.name: fileImport
parameters.description: The definition of the file to create including its purpose, the file name and the url of the file location.

201.description: The file has been successfully created.

Location.description: The location of the newly created item.

get.summary:
Gets a list of all fine-tune jobs owned by the Azure OpenAI resource.
The details that are returned for each fine-tune job contain besides its identifier
the base model, training and validation files, hyper parameters, time stamps, status and events.
Events are created when the job status changes, e.g. running or complete, and when results are uploaded.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last event from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Defaults to 20.

post.summary:
Creates a job that fine-tunes a specified model from a given training file.
Response includes details of the enqueued job including job status and hyper parameters.
The name of the fine-tuned model is added to the response once complete.

parameters.name: fineTuningJob
parameters.description:
The specification of the fine-tuned model to create.
Required parameters are the base model and the training file to use.
Optionally a validation file can be specified to compute validation metrics during training.
Hyper parameters will be set to default values or can be optionally specified.
These include batch size, learning rate multiplier, number of epochs and others.

201.description: The fine tune has been successfully created.

Location.description: The location of the newly created item.

get.summary:
Gets details for a single fine-tune job specified by the given fine-tune-id.
The details contain the base model, training and validation files, hyper parameters, time stamps, status and events.
Events are created when the job status changes, e.g. running or complete, and when results are uploaded.

parameters.name: fine-tuning-job-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the fine-tune job.

delete.summary: Deletes the fine-tune job specified by the given fine-tune-id.

parameters.name: fine-tuning-job-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the fine-tune job.

204.description: The fine tune was successfully deleted.

get.summary:
Gets the events for the fine-tune job specified by the given fine-tune-id.
Events are created when the job status changes, e.g. running or complete, and when results are uploaded.

parameters.name: fine-tuning-job-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the fine-tune job.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last event from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of events to retrieve. Defaults to 20.

get.summary:
Gets the checkpoints for the fine-tune job specified by the given fine-tune-id.
Checkpoints are created at the end of successful epochs during training.

parameters.name: fine-tuning-job-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the fine-tune job.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Identifier for the last checkpoint ID from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of checkpoints to retrieve. Defaults to 10.

post.summary: Cancels the processing of the fine-tune job specified by the given fine-tune-id.

parameters.name: fine-tuning-job-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the fine-tune job.

200.description: The fine tune has been successfully canceled

get.summary:
Gets a list of all models that are accessible by the Azure OpenAI resource.
These include base models as well as all successfully completed fine-tuned models owned by the Azure OpenAI resource.
Gets details for the model specified by the given modelId.

parameters.name: model-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the model.

post.summary:
An intermediate Upload object is created, allowing you to add Parts to it. Currently, an Upload size can be a maximum of 9 GB in total and will expire two hours after being created.
After the Upload is completed a File object will be generated, containing all the uploaded parts. This File object can then be used across our platform just like any other file.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: The definition of the file to create including its purpose and the location on the local machine.

200.description: The upload has been successfully created.

Location.description: The location of the newly created item.

post.summary:
Adds a Part to an Upload object, where each Part represents a segment of the file you are uploading.
Each Part can be up to the standard size limit for file upload, based on the File Purpose. You can continue adding Parts until reaching the Upload size limit of 9 GB.

parameters.name: upload-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the upload.

post.summary:
This completes the Upload, and the returned Upload object contains a nested File object that is ready for use across the platform.
You can define the order of the Parts by providing an ordered list of Part IDs.
The total number of bytes uploaded must match the size originally specified when creating the Upload object.
After this operation no additional Parts can be added once the Upload is completed.

parameters.name: upload-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the upload.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: The definition of the file to create including its purpose and the location on the local machine.

post.summary:
Cancels the Upload, and will lead to all uploaded parts to be deleted asynchronously.
No Parts may be added after an Upload is cancelled.

parameters.name: upload-id
parameters.description: The identifier of the upload.

Batch.title: Batch
Batch.description: Defines the values of a batch.

endpoint.description: The API endpoint used by the batch.

input_file_id.description: The ID of the input file for the batch.

completion_window.description: The time frame within which the batch should be processed.

output_file_id.description: The ID of the file containing outputs of successfully executed requests.

error_file_id.description: The ID of the file containing outputs of requests with errors.

created_at.description: A timestamp when this batch was created (in unix epochs).

in_progress_at.description: A timestamp when this batch started progressing (in unix epochs).

expires_at.description: A timestamp when this batch will expire (in unix epochs).

finalizing_at.description: A timestamp when this batch started finalizing (in unix epochs).

completed_at.description: A timestamp when this batch was completed (in unix epochs).

failed_at.description: A timestamp when this batch failed (in unix epochs).

expired_at.description: A timestamp when this batch expired (in unix epochs).

cancelling_at.description: A timestamp when this batch started cancelling (in unix epochs).

cancelled_at.description: A timestamp when this batch was cancelled (in unix epochs).

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the batch. This can be useful for storing additional information about the batch in a structured format.

BatchCreateRequest.title: BatchCreateRequest
BatchCreateRequest.description: Defines the request to create a batch.

input_file_id.description: The ID if the input file for the batch.

endpoint.description: The API endpoint used by the batch.

completion_window.description: The time frame within which the batch should be processed.

metadata.description: A set of key-value pairs that can be attached to the batch. This can be useful for storing additional information about the batch in a structured format.

BatchErrorData.title: BatchErrorData
BatchErrorData.description: Error information for a failure in batch.

code.description: An error code identifying the error type.

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error.

param.description: The name of the parameter that caused the error, if applicable (can be null).

line.description: The line number of the input file where the error occurred, if applicable (can be null).

BatchErrors.title: BatchErrors
BatchErrors.description: For batches that have failed, this will contain more information on the cause of the failures.

object.description: The type of the errors object. This is always 'list'.

BatchRequestCounts.title: BatchRequestCounts
BatchRequestCounts.description: The request counts for different statuses within the batch.

total.description: The total number of requests in the batch.

completed.description: The number of requests in the batch that have been completed successfully.

failed.description: The number of requests in the batch that have failed.

values.description: The input file is being validated before the batch can begin.
The input file has failed the validation process.
The input file was successfully validated and the batch is currently being executed.
The batch has completed and the results are being prepared.
The batch has been completed and the results are ready.
The batch was not able to complete within the 24-hour time window.
Cancellation of the batch has been initiated.
The batch was cancelled.

first_id.description: The id of the first batch in the list of batches returned.

last_id.description: The id of the last batch in the list of batches returned.

has_more.description: A value indicating whether the list contains more elements than returned.

Capabilities.title: Capabilities
Capabilities.description: The capabilities of a base or fine tune model.

fine_tune.description: A value indicating whether a model can be used for fine tuning.

inference.description: A value indicating whether a model can be deployed.

completion.description: A value indicating whether a model supports completion.

chat_completion.description: A value indicating whether a model supports chat completion.

embeddings.description: A value indicating whether a model supports embeddings.

Deprecation.title: Deprecation
Deprecation.description:
Defines the dates of deprecation for the different use cases of a model.
Usually base models support 1 year of fine tuning after creation. Inference is typically supported 2 years after creation of base or
fine tuned models. The exact dates are specified in the properties.

fine_tune.description: The end date of fine tune support of this model. Will be `null` for fine tune models.

inference.description: The end date of inference support of this model.

Error.title: Error
Error.description:
Error content as defined in the Microsoft REST guidelines
(https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses).

target.description: The location where the error happened if available.

ErrorCode.title: ErrorCode
ErrorCode.description:
Error codes as defined in the Microsoft REST guidelines
(https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses).

values.description: The requested operation conflicts with the current resource state.
The request data is invalid for this operation.
The operation is forbidden for the current user/api key.
The resource is not found.
The operation cannot be executed in the current resource's state.
The item does already exist.
The service is currently not available.
Internal error. Please retry.
Quota exceeded.
Validation of jsonl data failed.
Import of file failed.
Too many requests. Please retry later.
The current user/api key is not authorized for the operation.
Image generation failed as a result of our safety system.

ErrorResponse.title: ErrorResponse
ErrorResponse.description:
Error response as defined in the Microsoft REST guidelines
(https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses).

EventType.title: EventType
EventType.description: Defines the severity of a content filter result.

values.description: Event only contains human readable messages.
Event contains metrics.

File.title: File
File.description: A file is a document usable for training and validation. It can also be a service generated document with result details.

created_at.description: A timestamp when this job or item was created (in unix epochs).

bytes.description:
The size of this file when available (can be null). File sizes larger than 2^53-1 are not supported to ensure compatibility
with JavaScript integers.

status_details.description: The error message with details in case processing of this file failed.

FileCreate.title: FileCreate
FileCreate.description: Defines a document to import from an external content url to be usable with Azure OpenAI.

content_url.description: The url to download the document from (can be SAS url of a blob or any other external url accessible with a GET request).

FileDelete.title: FileDelete
FileDelete.description: Defines the response for File Delete.

deleted.description: A value indicating whether gets if the file was deleted.

FileDetails.title: FileDetails
FileDetails.description: A file detail is a document used by batch service to fetch file blob details.

path.description: The  the relative path to the file within the container.

storage_account_uri.description: The storage account url of this file.

storage_container_name.description: The Storage Container Name of this file blob.

FileImport.title: FileImport
FileImport.description: Defines a document to import from an external content url to be usable with Azure OpenAI.

filename.description:
The name of the [JSON Lines](https://jsonlines.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) file to be uploaded.
If the `purpose` is set to "fine-tune", each line is a JSON record with "prompt" and "completion" fields representing your training examples.

content_url.description: The url to download the document from (can be SAS url of a blob or any other external url accessible with a GET request).

values.description: The file has been uploaded but it's not yet processed. This state is not returned by Azure OpenAI and exposed only for compatibility. It can be categorized as an inactive state.
The operation was created and is not queued to be processed in the future. It can be categorized as an inactive state.
The operation has started to be processed. It can be categorized as an active state.
The operation has successfully be processed and is ready for consumption. It can be categorized as a terminal state.
The operation has completed processing with a failure and cannot be further consumed. It can be categorized as a terminal state.
The entity is ni the process to be deleted. This state is not returned by Azure OpenAI and exposed only for compatibility. It can be categorized as an active state.
The entity has been deleted but may still be referenced by other entities predating the deletion. It can be categorized as a terminal state.

FineTuningHyperParameters.title: FineTuningHyperParameters
FineTuningHyperParameters.description: The hyper parameter settings used in a fine tune job.

n_epochs.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.

batch_size.description:
The batch size to use for training. The batch size is the number of training examples used to train a single forward and backward pass.
In general, we've found that larger batch sizes tend to work better for larger datasets.
The default value as well as the maximum value for this property are specific to a base model.

learning_rate_multiplier.description:
The learning rate multiplier to use for training. The fine-tuning learning rate is the original learning rate used for pre-training multiplied by this value.
Larger learning rates tend to perform better with larger batch sizes.
We recommend experimenting with values in the range 0.02 to 0.2 to see what produces the best results.

FineTuningJob.title: FineTuningJob
FineTuningJob.description: Defines the values of a fine tune job.

created_at.description: A timestamp when this job or item was created (in unix epochs).

model.description: The identifier (model-id) of the base model used for the fine-tune.

fine_tuned_model.description:
The identifier (model-id) of the resulting fine tuned model. This property is only populated for successfully completed fine-tune runs.
Use this identifier to create a deployment for inferencing.

training_file.description: The file which is used for training.

validation_file.description: The file which is used to evaluate the fine tuned model during training.

result_files.description:
The result file identities (file-id) containing training and evaluation metrics in csv format.
The file is only available for successfully completed fine-tune runs.

finished_at.description: A timestamp when this job or item has finished successfully (in unix epochs).

organisation_id.description: The organisation id of this fine tune job. Unused on Azure OpenAI; compatibility for OpenAI only.

trained_tokens.description: The total number of billable tokens processed by this fine tuning job.

estimated_finish.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the fine-tuning job is estimated to finish. The value will be null if the fine-tuning job is not running.

suffix.description: The suffix used to identify the fine-tuned model. The suffix can contain up to 40 characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9,- and _) that will be added to your fine-tuned model name.

seed.description: The seed used for the finetuning job.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the checkpoint was created.

fine_tuned_model_checkpoint.description: The name of the fine-tuned checkpoint model that is created.

step_number.description: The step number that the checkpoint was created at.

metrics.title: Dictionary`2
metrics.description: The metrics at the step number during the fine-tuning job.

fine_tuning_job_id.description: The name of the fine-tuning job that this checkpoint was created from..

has_more.description: A value indicating whether the list contains more elements than returned.

FineTuningJobCreation.title: FineTuningJobCreation
FineTuningJobCreation.description: Defines the values of a fine tune job.

model.description: The identifier (model-id) of the base model used for this fine-tune.

training_file.description: The file identity (file-id) that is used for training this fine tuned model.

validation_file.description: The file identity (file-id) that is used to evaluate the fine tuned model during training.

suffix.description: The suffix used to identify the fine-tuned model. The suffix can contain up to 40 characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9,- and _) that will be added to your fine-tuned model name.

seed.description: The seed used for the finetuning job. Passing in the same seed and job parameters should produce the same results, but may differ in rare cases. If a seed is not specified, one will be generated for you.

FineTuningJobError.title: FineTuningJobError
FineTuningJobError.description: For fine-tuning jobs that have failed, this will contain more information on the cause of the failure.

param.description: The parameter that was invalid, usually training_file or validation_file. This field will be null if the failure was not parameter-specific.

created_at.description: A timestamp when this event was created (in unix epochs).

message.description: The message describing the event. This can be a change of state, e.g., enqueued, started, failed or completed, or other events like uploaded results.

data.description: Machine readable data of this event.

has_more.description: A value indicating whether the list contains more elements than returned.

FineTuningJobList.title: FineTuningJobList
FineTuningJobList.description: Represents a list of fine tunes.

has_more.description: A value indicating whether the list contains more elements than returned.

FineTuningState.title: FineTuningState
FineTuningState.description: The state of a finetunes object or fine tuning job.

values.description: The operation was created. This state is not returned by Azure OpenAI and exposed only for compatibility. It can be categorized as an inactive state.
The operation is not yet queued to be processed in the future. It can be categorized as an inactive state.
The operation has started to be processed. It can be categorized as an active state.
The operation has successfully be processed and is ready for consumption. It can be categorized as a terminal state.
The operation has been cancelled and is incomplete. It can be categorized as a terminal state.
The operation has completed processing with a failure and cannot be further consumed. It can be categorized as a terminal state.

InnerError.title: InnerError
InnerError.description:
Inner error as defined in the Microsoft REST guidelines
(https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses).

InnerErrorCode.title: InnerErrorCode
InnerErrorCode.description:
Inner error codes as defined in the Microsoft REST guidelines
(https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses).

values.description: The request data is invalid for this operation.

LifeCycleStatus.title: LifeCycleStatus
LifeCycleStatus.description:
The life cycle status of a model.
Note: A model can be promoted from "preview" to "generally-available", but never from "generally-available" to "preview".

values.description: Model is in preview and covered by the service preview terms.
Model is generally available.

LogLevel.title: LogLevel
LogLevel.description: The verbosity level of an event.

values.description: This event is for information only.
This event represents a mitigated issue.
This message represents a non recoverable issue.

Model.title: Model
Model.description: A model is either a base model or the result of a successful fine tune job.

created_at.description: A timestamp when this job or item was created (in unix epochs).

model.description: The base model identity (model-id) if this is a fine tune model; otherwise `null`.

fine_tune.description: The fine tune job identity (fine-tune-id) if this is a fine tune model; otherwise `null`.

OperationState.title: OperationState
OperationState.description: The state of a job or item.

values.description: The operation is not yet queued to be processed in the future.
The operation has started to be processed.
The operation has successfully be processed and is ready for consumption.
The operation has completed processing with a failure and cannot be further consumed.

Purpose.title: Purpose
Purpose.description: The intended purpose of the uploaded documents. Use "fine-tune" for fine-tuning. This allows us to validate the format of the uploaded file.

values.description: This file contains training data for a fine tune job.
This file contains the results of a fine tune job.
This file contains data to be used in assistants.
This file contains the results of an assistant.
This file contains the input data for a batch.
This file contains the results of a batch.

TypeDiscriminator.title: TypeDiscriminator
TypeDiscriminator.description: Defines the type of an object.

values.description: This object represents a list of other objects.
This object represents a fine tune job.
This object represents a file.
This object represents an event of a fine tuning job.
This object represents a checkpoint of a fine tuning job.
This object represents a model (can be a base model or fine tune job result).
This object represents a batch.
This object represents a file upload.
This object represents part of a file upload.

created_at.description: A timestamp when this job or item was created (in unix epochs).
A timestamp when this job or item was created (in unix epochs).

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example: https://aoairesource.openai.azure.com. Replace "aoairesource" with your Azure OpenAI account name).

api-key.name: api-key
api-key.description: Provide your Cognitive Services Azure OpenAI account key here.
